How to Clean and Sanitize a Cutting Board
Cutting boards don’t only get dirty, they get germy. Here are a couple of simple ways to safely clean and sanitize your cutting boards, with or without bleach.
More from Clorox experts
By
Mary Gagliardi
Discover more ways to clean.
Use as directed.
It’s important to keep safety in mind when cleaning or disinfecting kitchen surfaces. This is especially true with cutting boardsthat directly contact your food. We can show you how to keep your plastic, wood or bamboo cutting boards clean and safe for meal prep, whether you decide to use a simple bleach solution or opt for bleach-free products.
For bleach-free cleaning and sanitizing, use Free & Clear Disinfecting and Sanitizing Mist and Free & Clear Spray, two great products that are safe to use around kids, pets and food!* Just spray and go, no rinse required.

Steps to sanitize a cutting board with bleach
Pre-clean the cutting board
Use the sponge and the dish detergent to wash the cutting board with hot soapy water, then rinse with clean water.
Make the bleach sanitizing solution
Measure 1 gallon of water (16 cups) into the plastic dishpan, then add 2 teaspoons
Clorox® Disinfecting Bleach
.
Tip
Bleach and water solutions must be made fresh daily.
Sanitize the cutting board
Use the sponge to wipe the cutting board with the bleach and water solution, reapplying as needed so the surfaces stay wet. Smaller cutting boards can simply soak in the solution in the plastic dishpan.
Tip
To sanitize, surfaces must stay wet for 2 minutes.
Air dry
There is no rinsing step when sanitizing food-contact surfaces with a bleach and water solution. Simply set the cutting board aside to air dry, an make sure it is allowed to air dry completely before use.

Steps to sanitize a cutting board with Free & Clear Mist
Pre-clean the cutting board
Use the sponge and the dish detergent to wash the cutting board with hot soapy water, then rinse with clean water.
Sanitize the cutting board
Hold
Clorox® Free & Clear Disinfecting Mist
6-8 inches away from the surface and spray the cutting board until thoroughly wet.
Tip
Surface must remain visibly wet for 1 minutes to sanitize, or 2 minutes to disinfect.
Allow to dry
Treated surfaces will air dry in a few minutes, or they can be wiped dry with a paper towel.
Frequently Asked Questions
Can I clean kitchen surfaces with the Free & Clear products?
The Free & Clear product line is safe to use around food, pets and kids so you can clean kitchen surfaces with both the Free & Clear Compostable Cleaning Wipes or the Free & Clear Multi-Surface Spray Cleaner. No rinsing after cleaning is required.

An important safety message
Bleach and other disinfectants are not suitable for consumption or injection under any circumstances. People should always read the label for proper usage instructions. Disinfecting surfaces with bleach and the disinfecting products is one of the ways to help stop the spread of COVID-19, according to the Centers for Disease Control. Our products are safe when used as directed. It’s critical that everyone understands the facts in order to keep themselves safe and healthy.
